channel.title: Random space being taken up? wtf?
channel.description:
I noticed this a few days ago. Basically I have a shitty hard drive to begin with, only 40 gigs. But I make the most of it, and my computer is pretty good for the most part. RAM is 382 so I'm not running a slow piece of crap, but I'm certainly not on a super computer.. Anyhow, I was recently interested in getting an Ubuntu Dual Boot. I had about 8 gigs free at the time and Ron's tutorial said I needed 10. I knew I had a lot of cluttered useless junk in the first place, so I started deleted stuff and putting things on Disks. Anyway, when I was done I had 14.5G of free space. I came across a video with BattleField 2 in it, I'd heard alot about it, so I downloaded the Demo. It's like 500MB, so I could care less. I had 14 gigs, and I didn't download anything at all for the next day. I was still cleaning out my hard drive and I constantly look at the gigs available in my hard drive. It was down to 13.8. I was confused but I thought maybe I had done something I forgot about. The next day it's down to 13.6!? I knew I hadn't done anything to create this! And now, today, I'm down to 13.3 Gigs. 700 MB was created and I had nothing to do with it. My first thought was a virus, but I have a good anti-virus program so I doubt it (Norton 2004 ftw!!)(No, actually, I have Trend Micro PCcillin). Anyone know what might have done this?
[size=15pt][b]If your too lazy to read the above, I've gotten 700 MB from nothing in the last few days. Why?[/b][/size]

item.title: Random space being taken up? wtf?
item.dc:creator: @1337h4x 1337h4x
item.description:
@1337h4x wrote:

lower your cache size/clear out your garbage can?

Read full topic

item.source: Random space being taken up? wtf?

item.title: Random space being taken up? wtf?
item.dc:creator: @deoxys505 deoxys505
item.description:
@deoxys505 wrote:

do you have hidden and system files visible…if not then enable it in the control panel>folder options

then check and see if the program files folder where you installed the game is growing everyday. if not then watch the program files folders and if that grows then its one of your programs. then uninstall the program if you dont like the memory being taken up.

Read full topic
item.source: Random space being taken up? wtf?

item.title: Random space being taken up? wtf?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Go to Start and right click My Computer, click the System Restore tab. If I remember correctly, if you run out of space while System Restore is running, it will start to use normal space. :\ Else, download WinDirStat and look for unusual clumps of space.

Read full topic

item.source: Random space being taken up? wtf?

item.title: Random space being taken up? wtf?
item.dc:creator: @dragonus18 dragonus18
item.description:
@dragonus18 wrote:

ok i have one question. havr oyu downloaded anyhting off limewirer lately? i tried downloading starcraft off limewire once and it was a .rar file and when i unpacked it it turned out to be a bunch of other crappy-ass .rar files twith more .rar files in them and they kept unpacking and unpacking i got rid of all those then i get rid of limeiwre and it fixed it all

Read full topic
item.source: Random space being taken up? wtf?

item.title: Random space being taken up? wtf?
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Whatever’s causing it wouldn’t be able to create any new files…unless it really is a malicious application and it begins to delete essential files to make space for its junk (though I cannot say I’ve ever heard of anything like that in my life), you computer won’t simply “crash”. It will, of course, bug you and keep telling you that you have no more harddrive space, and you’ll find that a couple applications (such as archivers) will not be able to run properly, but nothing will crash.

Of course, it would be much easier if you get rid of whatever’s causing this soon.

Read full topic
item.source: Random space being taken up? wtf?

item.title: Random space being taken up? wtf?
item.dc:creator: @LegendaryLoser .Flair
item.description:
@LegendaryLoser wrote:

I’ll look for it, but if I was down to 10 KB and more files were constantly created from something wouldn’t that do something

Read full topic
item.source: Random space being taken up? wtf?

item.title: Random space being taken up? wtf?
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Try doing a windows search for files modified in the past couple days. If you know the filename or its location, we can probably help you more.

But just for your information, your computer would not simply crash because you’ve run out of harddrive space…

Read full topic

item.title: Random space being taken up? wtf?
item.dc:creator: @LegendaryLoser .Flair
item.description:
@LegendaryLoser wrote:

It’s not that it’s horrible now, but it concerns me that if it goes on my computer will crash from nothing.

And yes, I was thinking that, but I have FireFox delete everything once its turned off. I’ve also looked for every battlefield file and it just has like 1mb in the entire folder.

Also also… I haven’t set any restore points any time recently. Actually, never. They always f**k up.

Read full topic
